articles.headline: What 10 Years of Modi Rule Has Meant for India’s Economy
articles.snippet: Narendra Modi has kept India on its swift upward path among the world’s largest economies. Many Indians are better off, though wealth gaps have widened.
articles.abstract: Narendra Modi has kept India on its swift upward path among the world’s largest economies. Many Indians are better off, though wealth gaps have widened.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Narendra Modi was storming to victory in the election of 2014, he said that “acchhe din aane waale hain” — good times are coming.

articles.headline: China’s Advancing Efforts to Influence the U.S. Election Raise Alarms
articles.snippet: China has adopted some of the same misinformation tactics that Russia used ahead of the 2016 election, researchers and government officials say.
articles.abstract: China has adopted some of the same misinformation tactics that Russia used ahead of the 2016 election, researchers and government officials say.
articles.lead_paragraph: Covert Chinese accounts are masquerading online as American supporters of former President Donald J. Trump, promoting conspiracy theories, stoking domestic divisions and attacking President Biden ahead of the election in November, according to researchers and government officials.
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: The Church of Trump: How He’s Infusing Christianity Into His Movement
articles.snippet: Ending many of his rallies with a churchlike ritual and casting his prosecutions as persecution, the former president is demanding — and receiving — new levels of devotion from Republicans.
articles.abstract: Ending many of his rallies with a churchlike ritual and casting his prosecutions as persecution, the former president is demanding — and receiving — new levels of devotion from Republicans.
articles.lead_paragraph: Long known for his improvised and volatile stage performances, former President Donald J. Trump now tends to finish his rallies on a solemn note.

articles.headline: How One Tech Skeptic Decided A.I. Might Benefit the Middle Class
articles.snippet: David Autor, an M.I.T. economist and tech contrarian, argues that A.I. is fundamentally different from past waves of computerization.
articles.abstract: David Autor, an M.I.T. economist and tech contrarian, argues that A.I. is fundamentally different from past waves of computerization.
articles.lead_paragraph: David Autor seems an unlikely A.I. optimist. The labor economist at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology is best known for his in-depth studies showing how much technology and trade have eroded the incomes of millions of American workers over the years.

articles.headline: Will A.I. Boost Productivity? Companies Sure Hope So.
articles.snippet: Economists doubt that artificial intelligence is already visible in productivity data. Big companies, however, talk often about adopting it to improve efficiency.
articles.abstract: Economists doubt that artificial intelligence is already visible in productivity data. Big companies, however, talk often about adopting it to improve efficiency.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wendy’s menu boards. Ben & Jerry’s grocery store freezers. Abercrombie & Fitch’s marketing. Many mainstays of the American customer experience are increasingly powered by artificial intelligence.
articles.byline: By Jordyn Holman and Jeanna Smialek
